rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: a very good lecture. excellent ability to answer the questions in class and very honest. Introducing new knowledge and progress for old text and keep correcting the statement, results ..
Wonderful course!!!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Lopez is very nice and very willing to help if you go to office hours.  He isn't the clearest lecturer, but he's decent.  His tests are mostly concepts based, the calculations aren't hard, but the test average was still low.  They test that you get the big picture.  He curves and will bump you up if he sees you at office hours.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Wu is a very nice man, and wants the class to do well. The only problem is that he's not good at helping the class do well. One lecture might cover a whole chapter, another might cover one or two sections of a chapter. He spends too long on derivations, and not enough time ensuring class understanding. Prepare to teach yourself

Considering the overall quality of teachers in this department, he's not bad.  He knows his stuff, but is not very clear so you don't loose much by not coming.  Schroeder's book was very helpful...usually much clearer than Wu.  Tests are not very difficult.  Fair in partial credit, so at least put down the correct formula if you are out of time.
Great professor and great person. Once you get over accent, very very helpful. Let class go because only few people showed up after a 21st b-day celebration :) .
Hard, but not difficult to understand. His tests are not impossible if you study well. Also, be sure to do the homework, since it is a large part of your grade.
I have not heard one student say they liked his class (out of dozens).

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I took PHYS 118 with Sean over summer session 1, and I have got to say that he is one of the best science professors I have had at UNC. If you don't understand something, he will explain it again and again (in a different way each time), until you understand it. He encourages questions, and is a very fair professor.

When you are new to the material, you may get a sense that Sean's explanations are hasty and incomplete but you'll second guess yourself: "maybe it's just me, maybe I should focus on this lecture and then I'll get it". Wrong - his explanations truly are hasty and incomplete. Come to class, take detailed notes, but learn from TEXTBOOKS W SOLUTIONS!
Respectable professor. If you need help, he will make time. Behind the sarcasm, he's a great professor.
Horrible lecturer.  Makes you feel terrible for asking questions. Avoid.
Made it clear from day 1 he didn't care about this class or anyone in it. Scheduled appointments with him 4 times and he didn't bother to show up every time.
One of the best professors at the University.
Boo.
I had a lot of trouble in this class but I'm not a Physics person. Sometimes he didn't explain things very well. But he was really nice and laid back. A lot of people got As and Bs in there.

Sean is a very awsome and funny guy, however he was a pretty horrible 101 teacher (but he hates that class, so he is a much better teacher in 103).  He makes you feel like he hates answering your questions and that you are really really dumb, but in fact he loves when you ask him questions and just likes picking on you, that's his natural state :P.

Very approachable and friendly. Truly cares about you understanding the material. Lectures are difficult to decipher sometimes, and he has a habit of making you feel dumb if you don't immediately grasp concepts. Office hours are a must. Tests are HARD, but there's a generous curve.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Go to review sessions, they help a ton. Once you figure out what he expects the class is rewarding. I'm no physics major- so I learned a lot and found it really interesting. A good teacher, even with sometimes difficult subject matter.

Seems nice on the outside but after attending all review sessions during the semester he wouldnt cut me a break on the final grade over a difference on less than 1%...never curved exams either...grading structure on exams very questionable...HORRIBLE LAST IMPRESSION
I nearly failed his class due to some personal trauma but Superfine did everything he could to help me get credit for his course.  He is a great guy and his class is as fun as any other on campus.
A really cool, down to earth teacher but his blackboard stuff is a pain in the ass!
Prof. Superfine is awesome. He is funny....and makes learning fun and easy
He was a fabulous teacher. Was lively and animateed every class. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! They are SO helpful! I would highly recommend this course to everyone.
makes classes fun and interesting. definitely go to his office hours, very helpful.
Excellent teacher, not too hard, especially if you know what hes looking for. Easily the best class and teacher I have had here.
pain in the ass with his grading
Definitely an interesting class, but it is extremely hard.  Lots of homework assignments and difficult tests.  He's very personable and makes class interesting and enjoyable with demos.

He's really animated and funny!  His class is never boring and he obviously cares very much about his students.  He makes you as interested in physics as he is.  Definitely a good class to take, especially if you've never like physics before.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Office hours are helpful to a degree. Don't take me wrong, the physics is hard in general. but, she prides herself in giving exams with the highest score in a class of 50 ppl being an 82 and not curving.considers a B or greater to be stellar work. did 450 practice problems just for the final. Still made a B+.(from the organic student who makes ~95)
